definition: to abstain from voting/to forfeit/to waive one's right to vote/to abdicate
to abandon/to relinquish/to discard/to throw away

sentences.english: Twelve others excluded him, and four abstained.
sentences.chinese: 另外十二位把他排除了，而四位棄權。

sentences.english: Mr. Brown, Mr. Baker is defaulted , you will this walkover match.
sentences.chinese: 布朗先生，由於貝克先生棄權了，你不戰而勝。

sentences.english: The U.S. voted against the resolution; Russia abstained.
sentences.chinese: 美國投否決票，俄羅斯棄權。

sentences.english: And a few people that are abstaining.
A number of MPs also abstained.
sentences.chinese: 也有部分中央邦選民棄權。

sentences.english: No failure by either party to enforce any rights hereunder shall be construed a waiver.
sentences.chinese: 任何一方不履行其在本協議下的權利不應被視爲棄權。

sentences.english: As the final round use the single knock-out system, those who withdraw from the match will be disqualified.
sentences.chinese: 而複賽因採單淘汰制，故棄權者會被取消資格。

sentences.english: She picked up the waiver and scanned it.
sentences.chinese: 瑪格麗特拿起棄權聲明書，掃視了一遍。

sentences.english: Numerous abstentions marked the French elections.
sentences.chinese: 這次法國選舉的特點是棄權的人多。

sentences.english: He abstained from voting at the end of the debate.
sentences.chinese: 辯論結束投票時，他棄權了。

sentences.english: In Washington the Bureau of European Affairs recommended abstention.
sentences.chinese: 在華盛頓，歐洲事務司主張棄權。

sentences.english: China instead chose to abstain from the vote.
sentences.chinese: 相反，中國選擇投了棄權票。

sentences.english: The leaders asked their representatives to abstain from voting.
sentences.chinese: 領導者要求他們的代表投票時棄權。

sentences.english: Then the vote is unanimous with four abstentions.
sentences.chinese: 這次表決結果通過，四人棄權。

sentences.english: There are no waiver and estoppel rule in China's Insurance Law.
sentences.chinese: 我國保險法中沒有規定棄權和禁反言規則。

sentences.english: Thirty-seven abstained and one didn't cast vote.
sentences.chinese: 三十七人棄權，一人沒投票。

definition: to fail to be chosen (or elected)/to lose an election
